result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre M. Vongunten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The fine and costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning 8-1-22.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to S.L.F and W.F.  due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with all treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

9:43 AM Defendant Andre M. Vongunten in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Andre M. Vongunten. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Count 1 is amended to Battery without domestic abuse enhancer.  Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts.  Court orders in count 1 withheld sentence and placement on probation for one year with conditions of $300.00 fine which includes costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  No contact with S.L.F. and W.F.; letter of apology to S.L.F. and W.F. due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; AODA and follow through with all treatment recommendations.  Fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning August 1,  2022.
Status hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
